"The power of contributory conditions has near and distant forms.
Some are in this body and some are in other bodies.

source_sentence: 若近在此身者說名為因。
translation: If it's near to this body, it's said to be the cause.

source_sentence: 若遠在餘身者說名增上。
translation: If it's distantly present in another body, it's called contributory.
The treatise masters of Kāśmīra said.
"Form dharmas also have similar causes.
It's only except for the first uncontaminated form.
Q If that's the case, even though it's explained in terms of the great variety of aggregates, how will the things they cite be interpreted?
How will the things they refer to be shared?'
A The seeds were first present in the turbidity that emerged.
Because the other conditions were absent, grass didn't grow.
Later, when there are many other conditions, grass will grow.
Furthermore, there's a colony of water on a mountain peak with a roof.
When grasses and trees grow, the wind blows them, and birds carry them.
The seeds come to them and so they attain this.

source_sentence: 說一切有部發智大毘婆沙論卷第十七
translation: Saṃyuktâgama Abhidharma-mahāvibhāṣā-śāstra, Vol. 17
